text: <@U057DHLS75W> I would prefer adding my scripts to the footer or after the page is fully loaded unless I really need it in the head.

Thanks <@U0572Q18XLG>! You are referencing the main website. However, my client wants to keep these landing pages contained within HubSpot's ecosystem.

Can we use <https://go.livplasticsurgery.com/en-us/hair-transplant|this page> as an example?

Let's say I want to add the code to set a trigger to the Learn More button. Can this be done within HubSpot's CMS back end? Such as pasting the code in the HTML footer? (Screenshot attached). I am struggling to know where to add the custom code for this. I am very limited in coding knowledge but can get around if pointed in right direction.

Would I have to add your code to an editor like Brackets and then paste the new code in HubSpot?  I appreciate your time.

<@U0572Q18XLG> - Ah I see your note in the code window now. I inspected the Learn More button and here is the class. Right now, it's being anchored to a form to a page. I'd like to change the code to open the chat bot. Is this where I add your code? Once I change that, it's been updated?
